articles.title: Songun Politics of WPK Hailed by Mexican Party Leader
articles.content:
Songun Politics of WPK Hailed by Mexican Party Leader
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator (leader) of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, on March 23 met the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea which attended the 13th seminar of the world political parties on building a new society.
					At the meeting he expressed, on behalf of his party and on his own behalf, heartfelt thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il for having paid deep care so that the above-said seminar could be successfully held according to the Pyongyang Declaration on defending and advancing the cause of socialism.
					
					 He said that the reunification of Korea would be realized according to the just and fair proposal for reunification advanced by President Kim Il Sung and the historic joint declarations adopted between the north and the south.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Mexico fully supports the Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea and heartily celebrates all the achievements made by the Korean people under the great banner of Songun, he stressed.

articles.title: Halt to Security Authorities' Suppression Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Halt to Security Authorities' Suppression Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The All-People Committee for Measures against the Murder of Evacuees in Ryongsan of south Korea called a press conference in Seoul on Mar. 25 to denounce the security authorities for getting hell-bent on crackdown upon the organization.
					 Speakers at the press conference charged that the security authorities are intensifying the suppression of the above-mentioned committee only while turning aside the probe into the killing of Ryongsan evacuees and the punishment of those chiefly responsible for it.
					
					 Recalling that the authorities have deterred the committee from holding a rally, branding all memorial meetings sponsored by it until now since the tragic case in Ryongsan as "illegal", they said that such moves are a fascist dictatorial action of violating the elementary political freedom.
					
					 They demanded that the authorities immediately stop the unjust crackdown upon the organization and punish the chief murderers.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Human Rights Abuses under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Human Rights Abuses under Fire
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- At least 200 human rights organizations in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on March 25 denouncing the authorities' violation of human rights.
					 At the press conference speakers charged that on March 24 the police walked away two women human rights activists while getting hell-bent on suppression of the human rights organizations in a sit-in strike which was staged in protest against the unreasonable scheme of the Ministry of Administration and Security to weaken the function of the "Human Rights Committee".
					
					 They said that the ministry, far from renouncing such scheme to reduce the committee, set in motion the police to repress the sit-in strike of the human rights organizations and thus fully revealed once again its idol on human rights.
					
					 They declared that they would not pardon the authorities' suppression but fight it out to protect human rights.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported Abroad
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported Abroad
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The 13th seminar of the world political parties on building a new society was held in Mexico from Mar. 19 to 21.
					 Attending it were delegations and delegates of at least 100 political parities and organizations from over 40 countries, including the DPRK, China and Cuba, and members of the direction of the Workers' Party of Mexico. And present there on invitation were personages of the Mexican parliament and broad progressive front organizations and diplomatic envoys of various countries to Mexico.
					
					 At the seminar delegates of political parties and organizations of different countries stressed the need for the progressive political parties to maintain the revolutionary principle and stand against the U.S.-led imperialists to cope with their strategy for domination and strengthen the internationalist unity and solidarity among political parties in the world aspiring after socialism.
					
					 They noted with high appreciation that the Workers' Party of Korea has been firmly defending the sovereignty of the country and the cause of socialism from the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK and moves to stifle it, holding high the banner of Songun, and expressed full support and solidarity with it.
					
					 A joint statement was adopted at the seminar in support of the WPK and the Korean people in their efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation and reunify the country.
					
					 The statement said that it is an important internationalist duty of all the progressive political parties and the peace-loving peoples to support the struggle of the WPK and the Korean people.
					
					 It hoped that the heroic Korean people would achieve admirable successes in the general advance for bolstering the national power and building a great prosperous and powerful socialists nation.
					
					Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator (leader) of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, presented a letter to General Secretary Kim Jong Il on behalf of all the participants of the seminar as regards the successful holding of it.
					
					 The letter noted that Kim Jong Il set a worldwide example by not only turning the DPRK into the socialist power of Juche but also honorably defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country and the nation while standing against imperialism.
					
					 The revolutionary stamina and the indomitable spirit of the WPK and the Korean people serve as an inspiring banner giving confidence in victory to the all the progressive political parties and peoples the world over struggling for independence against imperialism and for socialism, it stressed.

articles.title: African Taekwon-Do Federation Formed
articles.content:
African Taekwon-Do Federation Formed
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The African Taekwon-Do Federation was formed with due ceremony in South Africa on Mar. 20.
					 Attending it were officials of the International Taekwon-Do Federation, personages concerned in Africa and Taekwon-Do players from different countries including South Africa, Ethiopia, Lesotho, Mozambique, Zimbabwe, Madagascar, UK and India.
					
					 Present on invitation were the ambassador and staff members of the DPRK embassy in South Africa.
					
					 The inauguration of the federation was declared, its rules and regulations adopted and members of its leadership elected there.
					
					 Speeches were made by the general executive director of the ITF and the secretary general of the ATF.
					
					 Then, the 1st African Open Taekwon-Do Championships were held until Mar. 22.
					
					A letter to General Secretary Kim Jong Il was adopted there.

articles.title: Kyoto Net for Japan-DPRK Friendship Formed
articles.content:
Kyoto Net for Japan-DPRK Friendship Formed
Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The Kyoto net for Japan-DPRK friendship promoting cultural, academic and citizen interchange was inaugurated with due ceremony in Kyoto of Japan on March 25.
					 Attending the ceremony were representatives of cultural, religious and academic organizations and other personages in Kyoto Prefecture who are working for promoting friendship and establishing diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Japan. 
					
					 Present on invitation were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and other officials of Chongryon. 
					
					 At the ceremony the achievements and experience gained in the work for friendship between the two countries and early establishment of bilateral diplomatic relations were introduced and the purpose for inauguration of the net and its action program and rules were discussed.
					
					 Kosho Mizutani, managing director of Buddhist College and chairman of the Executive Committee for Japan-DPRK Friendship Cultural Festival, was elected head of the net.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "For a Free and Peaceful New World" was brought out in pamphlet by a publishing house in Maritime Territory of Russia on the occasions of the Day of the Sun and the army day of the DPRK.
					 The work, published on April 29, Juche 80 (1991), clarifies the tasks and ways for building a new world, the desire of humankind.
